Posts.Content: Aww bless !!  I got Banish the Bags Eye cream and Youth code Luminize from my hubby .... 30 years of marriage and he still has'nt learnt anything !! all when my self esteem is low and I am goingvthrough a forced menapause. To be honest I have to see the funny side. .Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Fibregel , now an idea :))
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: hey lady you are ok to occassionally feel sorry for yourself and rant. Most of us have felt the same and like you wish people wouldnt say things unless they really mean it......most of the time its lip service. on a positive we know that if anyone we met wa ill or down , we would be there for them and thats what makes us special !!!. I KNOW WHAT YOU MEAN ABOUT PLUCKNG UP COURAGE TOO, WE ARE ALL TOO PROUD TO ASK FOR HELP AND WHEN WE DO , OTHERS SEEM TO HAVE THEIR AGENDA, Never mind Hun, its them that have the problem not you. On a practical note if you live in my kneck of the woods i will be over in a flash, LS25. Cheers Hun and a big hug too , Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Feeling Sorry for Myself Rant

Posts.Content: Do not beat yourself up Hun. We have all been there and it is only natural. It quite often happens that way , perhaps because we over tire ourselves and when we are tired we are vulnerable. lots of virtual hugs Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: had a good day now down

Posts.Content: Hi carol, give them a call they will help and sometimes clarity is all we need to stop hares running. mine was 17mm tubular cancer stage 1. My treatment plan was. sentinel node removal then wide local excision , have enough clearance so had third op. then had radiotheraphy X 14 sessions. I had bad reaction to Tamoxofin so now on Anatrozone and 4 weekly injections. my oncologist said as cancer goes stage one is the best ....none at all wud be better!! Keep asking questions to helps take pressure off. big hug Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Just got call from oncologist not good news

Posts.Content: Thank you give me a break , try to be positive , have just smiled at the irony. have just had a call from my ins company . sent them endless filled in questionnaires etc, they have had medical reports from my gp and consultant and now they want to know when my mum had colon cancer , date of diagnosis, when she was made aware and what age. my inner self was saying give me a break as if having cancer was not enough and miss my mum to bits cos she passed away 8 years ago from lung cancer after surviving 8 or 9 years fully recovered from colon cancer. Are these people totally insensitive. Soz for the moan , just as thought give me a break yours came in .that's when had to see the funny side Lots hugs Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: out of control and scared

Posts.Content: HI Amandajh we are like two peas in a pod ha ha. I  am sorry though that we have lots in common all because that Big C decided to hang onto us! yes Cancer Sucks big style . I try to be positive and keep on saying if I have to go through this what will I learn -Its nice that we can be open with each other on this site and I feel blessed to have you and the other ladies for company. All those big hugs keep us going, so am sending you a big one. I am always here to listen, take care and remember we are always thinking of each other. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: out of control and scared

Posts.Content: I am known for being in control and very positive. I have had surgery and treatments and currently on hormone therapy . thrown into a menapause and stiff joints for side effects. I  truely thought once all the boxes were ticked would return to my old self. I  do not , I feel out of control and scared that I have lost myself. I push everyone away and hide, the old Beevergirl Loved company and was always buoyant. Will get back to someone even I would like to be around.
Posts.Title: out of control and scared

Posts.Content: Ange when I read your response in so much of it I felt you were talking about me it rang so many bells. I too will undergo nipple reconstruction so run away because guess that may be another emotional stage. I  couldnt even look at the stick on false ones as a temp measure because just got too upsaet. thank you for your words it means a lot to me . its coming round to my 51st birthday - 5 sept but my 1st anniverasy re BC is the day after, I have told family and friends that I am skipping my birthday and having a normal week. you will know what mean. best wishes to you too. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: out of control and scared

Posts.Content: Hi there, I don't know what to say really other than we are all allowd emotional days and it is better out than in Hun. keeping the emotions in is very very draining and potentially physically thrteatening so I would let it all out wherever and when ever you need to. Life dishes us all sorts and we often ask why...it is'nt fair and can be cruel but remember the good times and savor the time you have together, I wish I was there to give you a huge hug. You are in my thoughts , with love Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Sister has just been diagnosed with secondary Liver Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi louise, just take little bites size pieces at present Hun, do not try to manage a full portion of crap in one go. We are all here to listen to you and where ever we can help you. I am always here to listen whether in an open comms or private message. I am not a fountain of Knowledge but an individual who is experiencing this rollacoaster called cancer. I send you an enormous hug and a big dose of courage and strength. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Need some comforting words too.

Posts.Content: Oops my size 5 in the mouth ha ha. anyhow she is very very lucky to have a very caring and considerate son.  I am still sending you a hug !  Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: For my mum!!

Posts.Content: Hiya Hun, your mum is so lucky to have a caring daughter like you , so for starters that's a positive. Googling can be so tempting but like evrything has its limits. Just take a day at a time and use your energy to look after yourself and your mum. It is so natural for us to all want to know the full picture as quick as possible but getting the full diagnosis takes time Hun . Once they have that they will then look at a made to measure treatment plan for your mum. You have lots of mac friends here so don't bottle things up, come onto the site when ever , rant , rave shout , cry we will all listen and support you. a big hug!! Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: For my mum!!

Posts.Content: Thank you misty my daughter has just called in and said the same- hope your recovery is progressing .
Posts.Title: Lipofilling

Posts.Content: Recently had lipofilling -last Wednesday - initially all ok but last night bottom of boob rock hard and a sizeable area. Still got dressings on until I get outpatient appointment for next week. Is this normal
Posts.Title: Lipofilling

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha Rose good to hear from you. sorry have'nt replied sooner. I did'nt take the anatrozole this morning , I am goint to take your advise and take either with evening meal or around 8pm as suggested , I am open to all ideas. I am currently sat trying to chill out in my caravan , on a weekend away ....ok well one night away :ha ha. I hope you are feeling better, we all seem to have good days and not so good days. lots of hugs Beevergirlxx. will report back soooooon xxx
Posts.Title: It's our body

Posts.Content: Hi  I am on anatrozole which is for post menapause wpmen so have to have 4 wkly injections to stop ovaries as have'nt gone through menapause. I take my meds as soon as I wake up at 6,30 am so I will try taking it with food and see how io go. I have put up with it as I had to be taken off tamoxofin and feel like am here again. I am due to see my oncologist  soon so will mention it perhaps. thank you though , at least I know I am not imaging it. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: It's our body

Posts.Content: Hi KateG , it is so encouraging to here news like yours, it is coming up to a year to my first diagnosis. Unfortunately was diagnosed the day after my 50th birthday , 6th Sept 2011 so not a good birthday gift. I am a little down and just want next week to come and go but your blog encouraged me to sit up and stop feeling sorry for myself.  Tamoxofin did not agree with my body and so was put on Anatrozole and have to have Goserin injections every 4 weeks so I currently struggle with stiff joints that make me feel restricted and old , however. I am here to tell the tale and thankful , so I will try my hardest to sit up and get rid of my blues. Thank you KateG  Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Hiya Hun, just take a day at a time. initially they prepared me for a full mastectomy but then when I saw the plastic surgeon he said a wide local excision would be ok. use up your energy before you need to. just take a day at a time, I  know it is hard your mind runs on over time   Hugs to you Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Hi, I'm new

Posts.Content: 4 years post diagnosis , on anatrozole and 4 weekly zoladex injections. Really bad pain in finger joints at night and my first and middle finger go numb. Lost sense of smell and taste and have a tightness in my kneck when I lay down. Seems they either put it down to side effects or lend a deaf ear! Should I just get on with it or ask for answers from my GP and get referred?? Drs seem to think we get paranoid after being diagnosed with cancer . I usually put up with stuff but lately think I should stand my ground ..... Any comments welcome
Posts.Title: 4 years post diagnosis but still aches and pains

Posts.Content: Hi julie   I feel for u Hun , I was diagnosed sept 11 had surgery and radds then the drreaded hormone  therapy , tamoxofin made me ill so had to go onnto Zoladox and anatrozole like you achiiNg joints , a year on from diagnosis and struggling , I am sending a dose of hope cos know it feels sh#T Xxxxx
Posts.Title: staying positive

Posts.Content: Hi Hun , yep do understand and hope if nowt else that brings u comfort. Like u am normally upbeat    and see my glass overflowing but sometimes think we get drained, at present wish folks wud accept feel shit and just listen. anyhow I will always listen ro Fellow mac mates, sending  a hug too
Posts.Title: staying positive

Posts.Content: Hello, my main treatment finished last year and now on hormone therapy with terrible side effects and thrown into forced menapause HOWEVER.  I was so piddled off with myself that signed up for swimming lessons although I am frightened of water ha ha. Now done 6 lessons and practice in between !!! young ones work with have said they join me in a sponsored swim in sept - proceeds half to macmillan , half to our local hospice, Its the one thing I am focusing on as other things are a bit crappy. I will keep you posted - GO for whatever you can manage Mac friends !!!xxx  Beevergirlxx.............or will I re- name to Dolphin woman ha ha
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hey Winston don't feel bad. We all need comfort and the important thing is we are all here for each other. Different things tip us over the edge , that's why we are individuals. If it is any comfort I too went through stages where I was sick of Medical appointments but I guess it is for the greater good. Remember you have gone a long way down that round and always managed to keep on the road  so give yourself a big pat on the back. Sending a ginormous hug and reminding you that your Macmate is always here. love Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Hey Winston don't feel bad. We all need comfort and the important thing is we are all here for each other. Different things tip us over the edge , that's why we are individuals. If it is any comfort I too went through stages where I was sick of Medical appointments but I guess it is for the greater good. Remember you have gone a long way down that round and always managed to keep on the road  so give yourself a big pat on the back. Sending a ginormous hug and reminding you that your Macmate is always here. love Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha Rose, I can not possibly comment about your decision to accept chemo or not but will say your opening thread struck a chord with me - in so much asI Iam grateful that my Big C was treated without chemo and for some reason. I get the guilts and think I  have had it easy. I only joined the group a week ago searching for support because know I  struggle to accept what. I have been through - many times I onder if too should be here, but reading the threads has helped me realease some tears - tears of sadness and tears of joy. I believe none  of us will judge and all that I will say is - I am always here to listen . lots of love and Hugs  Beevergirl xx
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

Posts.Content: Hiya,    My treatment did not include chemo, but my tutor suggested wearing a swimming cap - avoids goggles getting knotted up, so I am the only one in the pool with a speedo cap on - just an idea but wud avoid being embarrassed . Re : Jelly , again I do not have a prosthesis , however my 3 lots of surgery has resulted in a very misshaPped boob with no nipple, I was very very embarrassed but sooo fed up with myself I had to overcome it somehow. I bought a tankini , which looks like a sports top with shorts and always enter the pool with my towel drapped over my shoulder. see my profile pic. The pool I swim in , is 1.5 metrs so only my head sits above the water. Hope that helps  Beevergirlxx progressing to Dolphin woman ha ha xxxx
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hiya,    My treatment did not include chemo, but my tutor suggested wearing a swimming cap - avoids goggles getting knotted up, so I am the only one in the pool with a speedo cap on - just an idea but wud avoid being embarrassed . Re : Jelly , again I do not have a prosthesis , however my 3 lots of surgery has resulted in a very misshaPped boob with no nipple, I was very very embarrassed but sooo fed up with myself I had to overcome it somehow. I bought a tankini , which looks like a sports top with shorts and always enter the pool with my towel drapped over my shoulder. see my profile pic. The pool I swim in , is 1.5 metrs so only my head sits above the water. Hope that helps  Beevergirlxx progressing to Dolphin woman ha ha xxxx
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hello, my main treatment finished last year and now on hormone therapy with terrible side effects and thrown into forced menapause HOWEVER.  I was so piddled off with myself that signed up for swimming lessons although I am frightened of water ha ha. Now done 6 lessons and practice in between !!! young ones work with have said they join me in a sponsored swim in sept - proceeds half to macmillan , half to our local hospice, Its the one thing I am focusing on as other things are a bit crappy. I will keep you posted - GO for whatever you can manage Mac friends !!!xxx  Beevergirlxx.............or will I re- name to Dolphin woman ha ha
Posts.Title: Exercise

Posts.Content: Hi Shelly , we all think we rant or go on but the truth is we o not. We just have to have a channel to let our feelings out. My advise just take a day at a time, that way you conserve a bit of energy. I am always here to listen , Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Confused at the moment!!!

Posts.Content: To all those out there , what ever your status I am here too for you to write to. we all need people to listen to . hugs to you all. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Thanks SueT45 , you take it easy a change of scenery is good and some nice food and rest. I will be thinking about you. hugs Beevergirlxx or should change it to dingbat ha ha
Posts.Title: Naïve or a dingbat

Posts.Content: Ok mac friends its a tough day for me the anniversary of my diagnosis which is tres difficult because have not really come to terms with the big c yet if you know what mean. Anyhow what do know is we all have good days and not so good days , so am appealing to humour here in the hope that I cause laughs for all irrespective of where they are  ie. on a good day or not so good day.  HHere goes, eventually pluck up courage to enlist on the said BC group, fumble with chat room , blog or whatever the technology is called. sort of get to grips with it , then comes the signature name , ummm oh dear my memory is not what it used to be so plump for a nick name an old colleague gave me , my surnames Beever and I was way back then young although we still meet for a brew now and he still calls me it, Beevergirl. .....then pick up courage to share with my hubby , daughter and close friend that have made a positive move forward. When tell them my signature name they roll about laughing. is the joke on me ha ha. Hope it has raised some laughs my mac friends . I am in a want to be alone mood so have a caring boss who has let me work from home today with it being a sensitive day. lots of hugs, reassurances we will all get through and love Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Naïve or a dingbat

Posts.Content: Hi shelley as long as I have put a smile on your face I am happy. MY typing on the blackberry is humarous too, seems to miss out I .Try and have an hourly chuckle at my expense, huge hugs Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Naïve or a dingbat

Posts.Content: Hi I have been on Anatrozole and Goserlin - zoladex injections since Jan 2012. At times struggled with side effects - hot flushes and severe joint pain . Joint pain in ankles went after a year. Joint pain in hands still trouble some. Hot flushes were terrible but my be nurse suggested a lady are magnet !! Boots sell it around £25 .some ladies it works for some it doesn't - for me .... Significant improvement. Whilst having lip filling as reconstruction mentioned to a young lady who was in too - her mum suffered hot flushes - she emailed me later - instant success . It's worth the £25 to try. 4 years on and still on treatment I have moments when I'm going to pack it in .... But then I stick it out. Good luck I hope it works for you too Beever girl xx
Posts.Title: Too Many Hot Flushes

Posts.Content: Hi Rusty , was diagnosed last sept day after my 50 , considered myself fit and was gob smacked to say the least. - have got through 3 ops and radiotheraphy and onto hormone therapy - we all have those roller coaster feelings , days when our eyes continue to leak and ask why me ? we are all here to suppport  you , reassure you that you are not cracking up and to bring a little smile to your face. lots of hugs  Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: New to all this!!

Posts.Content: Hope this puts your mind at rest , since diagnosis and treatment my migraines have been more often, think it's the stress and certainly painkillers with codeine in them trigger mine off. I hpe they pass soon for you, they are not pleasant. big hug Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Migraines

Posts.Content: Found another lump - hoping it's fat narcrossis. Was diagnosed in 2011 but never ever felt a lump - found on first mammogram. Been fast tracked had mammogram, scan and 3 biopsies taken , now waiting for results although feeling positive - they just said the scan etc were indeterminate so I'm hoping they're just being cautious. My lump is read and hard ?? Any clues
Posts.Title: Deja vu- another lump after 6 yrs

Posts.Content: been on Anatrozole for 16 months and still on it. Was on Arimidex injections every 4 weeks but temp off them to see if i have entered naturalmenapause. Had bad joint pain throughout and tingling of hands at night. Recentlymy hands cramp up and i feel every little bone. Is this side effects or am i starting wiith arthiritis ? rhumatism ? will it show on a bone densitiy scan in jan?
Posts.Title: arthiritis or side effcts from meds ?

Posts.Content: Another tip , put your aqeous cream in the fridge , when your skin is itchy and you put the cream on - the chilled cream really soothes . My BCN gave me the tip. Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Last hurdle!!!!!

Posts.Content: Finished Radiotheraphy and now on hormone tratment. taking Anastrozole daily and have Zoladex ( Goserelin ) injections every 4 wks . suffering bad joint pain , and of course night sweats. is this the norm ??
Posts.Title: Joint pain

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen , yes very useful - reckon it takes the meds time to get in your system and then a settling in period - as you can see try to see my glass half full if not overflowing but the BC has been a big big test !! my hands, feet and knees are the worse - try not to moan as my hubby suffers from clinical depression - so tend to shut up and put up. thanks for answering it does make a difference , especially when folks are in a position like me and can not off load at home. you ladies are the best !! hugs  Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: Joint pain

Posts.Content: Well Mac friends its been a rollacoaster and a half this last year but expecting to go out for a quiet meal last night , hubby and I were surprised that my best friend Debs and my daughter had arranged a surprise party to celebrate our 30 th wedding anniversary and my birthday. They did us proud and all the folks that came have in their own way supported me through thick and thin. Debs and Caitlin know me well , and so asked that donations be given instead of gifts. Donations to be split between our local hospice - where Debs is a ward sister and half to breast cancer. I count my blessings as reflect  love, hugs to all Beevergirlxx with a huge hangover
Posts.Title: Count our blessings

Posts.Content: Hello all - reading your comments has been useful - ivebeen on anatrozole /arimidex for4yrs progressively got more and more problems- gained 1 stone , numb hands at night , recently when laid in bed on my back I feel my breathing stops momentarily and I wake. Contestant lay loosing hair , eyebrows thinning and recently feel cold - I asked for a thyroid test 18 months ago but they said all was ok and haven't had a blood test for2-3 years - seem tone left to it - think I may assert self and cast aside the thought that the doctors may think I'm a hypocondreact. Thank you ladie
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/ Arimidex: SE: Raised Blood Cholesterol ?

Posts.Content: I had mine sept 2011 and still have a slight blue tinge. My friend sent me a postcard of a Blue tit bird , yes humour . it does'nt really bother me in the big picture xx
Posts.Title: Blue/green dye from Sentinel Node Biopsy

Posts.Content: I hope I am not being too optomistic but , I have had severe joint pain since being on Arimidex and Anatrozole sine April ,however started taking Anatrozole with my evening meal and saw some improvement. this last week and a bit cut down on my tea intake dramatically , especially on an afternoon and night - I do not drink coffee. I seriously think things have improved sleep wise and joint pain. I struggle with stiff hands, knees and feet when get up but not had the severe night pain. I recalled last night a conversation with a friend a few years ago , he said an indian lady had told him tea can give you joint pain / arthiritas.  i will keep mac friends posted
Posts.Title: Arimidex V Aromasin

Posts.Content: Not sure how to reply to you Vanda. Have u had Zoladex injection and then starting Anatrozone tablets - if so I  am on the same regime. my hot flushes have got better since started wearing the lady care magnet and just have joint pain with the tablets , although first three months have any effects. am sure it will go ok - keep smiling - the suns shining here ....well for know ha ha  Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: new and scared...

Posts.Content: Hi Hun , I wish I was nearby to give you a hug, wipe your tears and just listen. A good cry and the physical act of poring it all out helps but I recognise sometimes we need people to ask and almost give us permission to let it all out , if we don't get this go ahead we start feeling guilty and very self critical. Just go with the flow !! I am always here , pm me anytime .lots of hugs Beevergirlxx
Posts.Title: so fed up of it all
